Name: Visser et al. 2015 Psychoneuroendocrinology
Acknowledgements: The authors would like to thank M. Spaan and B. Molenkamp for technical support, J. Bosch and C. Kirschbaum for the saliva-analysis, P. Vonk for supervising the medical aspects of the study and A. Eigenhuis for blinding and counterbalancing of the experimental procedure and statistical advice.
Funding: This work was supported by a Vici grant (M. Kindt, #45307-006) from the Netherlands Organization for Scientific Research.
EthicsApprovals: Procedures were executed in compliance with relevant laws and institutional guidelines and were approved by the local ethics committee (University of Amsterdam, The Netherlands; 2013-CP-2387).
ReferencesAndLinks: Visser, R M, A E Kunze, B Westhoff, H S Scholte, and M Kindt. 2015. “Representational Similarity Analysis Offers a Preview of the Noradrenergic Modulation of Long-Term Fear Memory at the Time of Encoding.” Psychoneuroendocrinology 55: 8–20.
